newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Brembo sees '97 turnover 15 pct up.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Brembo sees '97 turnover 15 pct up.

text.p: Italian automotive brake manufacturing group Brembo said it expected turnover to increase 15 percent in 1997 and considered 1996 results were below expectations, affected in part by extraordinary factors.
The company last week announced consolidated net profits fell to 19.1 billion lire in 1996 from 30.1 billion previously although turnover rose to 357.4 billion from 331.2 billion.

It said in a statement on Tuesday it expected parent turnover to rise in 1997 and profits before financial charges and tax should reach 10.5-11.0 percent of turnover in 1997 and 11.5-12.0 percent in 1998.
Consolidated sales should rise 15 percent in 1997 with a profit before financial charges and tax equal to 10.5 percent of turnover and net profit at around six percent.
